On 9/2/11, Sandy Panico <magicquartz@...=
> wrote:
> OOC:  True the Dinobots are formidable but Tucson isn't exactly =
helpless
> either.  He may not be able to hold up in a tough battle with th=
e Dinobots
> but he is still able to scoot out of the way when it depends o=
n his life.
> He doesn't intend to attack, he's just defending himself.  An=
d yeah, there
> is an earthquake going on but agility was something he stud=
ied and worked
> hard on, so perhaps he may stumble a slight but he does kn=
ow how to right
> himself by practicing balance.  A big focus in Kung Fu an=
d Ninjutsu .
>
> The crouching maneuver was something I learned from watchi=
ng a lot of Kung
> Fu movies.  First, potential energy is stored in the mus=
cles and then the
> result is the release of that energy, making it Kinetic=
 energy, and that's
> what Tucson was doing.  Not quite on his knees, but o=
n his feet.  And from
> there, he's able to launch his body straight up, re=
leasing the Kinetic
> energy stored in his body.   I hope this makes it eas=
ier to understand.
> Sorry for the complexity of my last post.
>
> Perpetua=
lly on the move and constantly busy.
>

Think about how powerful the Dinobots were on TF Animated. They were

 are more like G1 comics in ability, but you can get the idea.
>>
>> - Pres=
ton

only shoot so far before they run out of power.  Now, let's
